findings.title: Use of SafeMath in Solidity 0.8 or later
Lack of payable declaration on receive function
Default values
Short variable names
Excessive loop in getAmountsIn
quote does not revert on insufficient input amount
DEX address passed into initialize is not zero validated
Default visibility
quote function does not revert on reserveIn being zero
Missing context in error message
Index used in loop is not externally capped
ratio calculation may have precision loss
Lack of existence checks can prevent tokens from being withdrawn
returnLastFee is state changing but not documented and should be internal
getAmountsOut and getAmountsIn use require for length check
Division by zero
quote function may overflow
Loss of precision in getAmountOut and getAmountIn
Possible overflow in computation of amount in pairFor
Type conversion uint112 to uint256 in getReserves is unsafe
Inconsistent fixed point precision
Flash loan price manipulation
Malicious token behavior (batch transfer)
Unable to refund ETH sent to Router
User supplied data may be incorrect
Incorrect reserve values returned in getAmountsIn
Presale function is susceptible to partial refund
uniswapV2Call allows transfer of arbitrary token amounts
adjustLiquidity can be called repeatedly by anyone
Approvals do not decrease allowance and can be reused
addLiquidity can manipulate amounts in presale pool
Presale token can be transferred without transferFrom
